Sentencas: This Study examines the performance of a ten-cell solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) stack with a non-uniform flow rate in the stacking direction.
Titulo: Effect of inlet flow maldistribution in the stacking direction on the performance of a solid oxide fuel cell stack

Sentencas: The author develops a two-dimensional numerical method to solve the electrochemical, mass and energy equations one stack at a time.
Titulo: Effect of inlet flow maldistribution in the stacking direction on the performance of a solid oxide fuel cell stack

Sentencas: The energy equations couple the heat exchange between the interconnector and both the cell and the flowing gas of adjacent cells.
Titulo: Effect of inlet flow maldistribution in the stacking direction on the performance of a solid oxide fuel cell stack

Sentencas: Moreover, this paper considers two boundary conditions, adiabatic and constant temperature, on the top and bottom faces of the SOFC.
Titulo: Effect of inlet flow maldistribution in the stacking direction on the performance of a solid oxide fuel cell stack

Sentencas: The results show that the non-uniform inlet flow rate of the fuel dominates the current density distribution; it causes the cell voltage to vary by over 13% for both boundary conditions.
Titulo: Effect of inlet flow maldistribution in the stacking direction on the performance of a solid oxide fuel cell stack

Sentencas: In addition, the constant temperature condition in this study can produce 3% more power than with the adiabatic condition.
Titulo: Effect of inlet flow maldistribution in the stacking direction on the performance of a solid oxide fuel cell stack

Sentencas: On the other hand, the air dominates the temperature field of a SOFC, and the non-uniform inlet flow rate of the air produces a variation of 3% in the average cell temperature of the cells when the boundary condition is adiabatic.
Titulo: Effect of inlet flow maldistribution in the stacking direction on the performance of a solid oxide fuel cell stack

Sentencas: This non-uniform effect on the electrical performance of each stack is apparently larger than in the transverse direction, which has been examined in our previous research.
Titulo: Effect of inlet flow maldistribution in the stacking direction on the performance of a solid oxide fuel cell stack
